attrs.description: It sets the configuration whether the x-axis labels will be displayed or not.
attrs.name: showLabels

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set whether the data labels would show up as rotated labels on the chart.
attrs.name: rotateLabels

attrs.description: By default, all the labels are displayed on the chart. However, if you have a set of streaming data (like name of months or days of week), you can opt to show every n-th label for better clarity. This attribute just lets you do so. It allows to display every n(th) y-axis label.
attrs.name: labelStep

attrs.description: The entire chart can now act as a hotspot. Use this URL to define the hotspot link for the chart. The link can be specified in FusionCharts Link Format.
attrs.name: clickURL

attrs.description: If you want to hide volume chart, you can use this attribute.
attrs.name: showVolumeChart

attrs.description: Height of the volume chart in percent (with respect to total chart). By default, it's set to 40%.
attrs.name: volumeHeightPercent

description: These attributes let you control a variety of functional elements on the chart. For example, you can opt to show or hide data labels, data values. You can also set chart limits and extended properties.

attrs.description: Caption of the chart.
attrs.name: caption

attrs.description: Sub-caption of the chart.
attrs.name: subCaption

attrs.description: The y-axis name for the price chart.
attrs.name: pYAxisName

attrs.description: The y-axis name for the volume chart.
attrs.name: vYAxisName

description: Using these attributes, you can set the various headings and titles of chart like caption, sub-caption and y-axis names etc.

attrs.description: Sets the caption font size in pixels
attrs.name: captionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font size (in pixels)
attrs.name: subCaptionFontSize

attrs.description: Whether the caption font should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: captionFontBold

attrs.description: Whether the sub caption font should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: subCaptionFontBold

description: These attributes let you configure the cosmetics of chart caption and sub-caption.

attrs.description: The y-axis of the charts is divided into vertical sections using div (divisional) lines. Each div line assumes a value based on its position. Using this attribute you can set whether to show those div line (y-axis) values or not.
attrs.name: showYAxisValues

attrs.description: By default, all div lines show their values. However, you can opt to display every x(th) div line value using this attribute.
attrs.name: yAxisValuesStep

attrs.description: If you do not wish to rotate y-axis name, set this as 0. It specifically comes to use when you have special characters (UTF8) in your y-axis name that do not show up in rotated mode.
attrs.name: rotateYAxisName

attrs.description: The candlestick chart has both x and y axis as numeric. This attribute lets you explicitly set the x-axis lower limit. If you do not specify this value, the chart will automatically calculate the best value for you.
attrs.name: xAxisMinValue

attrs.description: The candlestick chart has both x and y axis as numeric. This attribute lets you explicitly set the x-axis upper limit. If you do not specify this value, the chart will automatically calculate the best value for you.
attrs.name: xAxisMaxValue

attrs.description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the upper limit of the price chart. If you don't specify this value, it is automatically calculated by the chart based on the data provided by you.
attrs.name: pYAxisMaxValue

attrs.description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the lower limit of the price chart. If you don't specify this value, it is automatically calculated by the chart based on the data provided by you.
attrs.name: pYAxisMinValue

attrs.description: Lower limit for the volume chart axis. If you do not specify this, the chart will automatically calculate for you.
attrs.name: vYAxisMinValue

attrs.description: Upper limit for the volume chart axis. If you do not specify this, the chart will automatically calculate for you.
attrs.name: vYAxisMaxValue

description: Using these attributes, you can set and configure x-axis labels, y-axis values and set chart cosmetics for the axis like color, alpha, etc.

attrs.description: Specifies the primary y-axis font size
attrs.name: pYAxisNameFontSize

attrs.description: Whether primary y-axis font should be bold
attrs.name: pYAxisNameFontBold

attrs.description: Whether primary y-axis font should be italicized
attrs.name: pYAxisNameFontItalic

description: When using a dual y-axis chart (having a primary and a secondary axis), these attributes let you configure the cosmetics of the primary axis name (title)

attrs.description: Specifies the volume y-axis font size
attrs.name: vYAxisNameFontSize

attrs.description: Whether volume y-axis font should be bold
attrs.name: vYAxisNameFontBold

attrs.description: Whether volume y-axis font should be italicized
attrs.name: vYAxisNameFontItalic

description: When using a dual y-axis chart, these attributes let you configure the cosmetics of the volumne y-axis name (title)

attrs.description: To place any image (JPG/PNG/GIF) as background of the chart, enter the (path and) name of the background image. It should be in the same domain as the chart.
attrs.name: bgImage

attrs.description: You can load an external logo (JPEG/PNG) to your chart, this attribute lets you specify the URL. Due to cross domain security restrictions it is advised to use a logo from the same domain name as your charts.
attrs.name: logoURL

description: The following attributes let you configure chart cosmetics like background color, background alpha, canvas color & alpha etc.

attrs.description: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the price chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if 'formatNumber': '1'; and 40000 if 'formatNumber': '0';.
attrs.name: formatNumber

attrs.description: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it - e.g., if `formatNumberScale` is set to 1, 1043 would become 1.04K (with decimals set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end.
attrs.name: formatNumberScale

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the price chart. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the chart, you could specify this attribute to $ to show like $40000, $50000.
attrs.name: numberPrefix

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you could add suffix to all the numbers visible on the price chart. For example, to represent all figures quantified as per annum on the chart, you could specify this attribute to '/a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a.
attrs.name: numberSuffix

attrs.description: This attribute helps you specify the character to be used as the thousands separator in a number.
attrs.name: thousandSeparator

attrs.description: This option helps you specify the position of the thousand separator.
attrs.name: thousandSeparatorPosition

attrs.description: Number of decimal places to which all numbers on the price chart would be rounded to.
attrs.name: decimals

attrs.description: Whether to add 0 padding at the end of decimal numbers. For example, if you set decimals as 2 and a number is 23.4. If `forceDecimals` is set to 1, the number will automatically be converted to 23.40 (note the extra 0 at the end).
attrs.name: forceDecimals

attrs.description: This configuration determines whether the numbers belonging to volume chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if 'vFormatNumber': '1'; and 40000 if 'vFormatNumber' : '0';
attrs.name: vFormatNumber

attrs.description: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number belonging to volume chart after truncating and rounding it - e.g., if `vFormatNumberScale` is set to 1, 10434 would become 1.04K (with `vDecimals` set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end.
attrs.name: vFormatNumberScale

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers belonging to volume chart.
attrs.name: vNumberPrefix

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers belonging to volume chart.
attrs.name: vNumberSuffix

attrs.description: Number of decimal places to which all numbers belonging to volume chart would be rounded to.
attrs.name: vDecimals

description: PowerCharts XT offers you a lot of options to format your numbers on the chart. Using the attributes below, you can control a myriad of options like: Formatting of commas and decimals Number prefixes and suffixes Decimal places to which the numbers would round to Scaling of numbers based on a user defined scale Custom number input formats

attrs.description: Lets you specify font size for the x-axis data labels.
attrs.name: fontSize

description: The `categories` object and the `category` object (child of  the `categories` object)  are used to specify x-axis labels for multi-series charts. The attributes of the `categories` object are used to set the font properties of all x-axis labels collectively.

attrs.description:
This attribute determines the label for the data item. The label appears on the x-axis of chart.

 __Note__: The `label` attribute replaces the `name` attribute. Previously, either one of the attributes could be used to set the label. Support for the `name` attribute has been discontinued since v3.10.0.
attrs.name: label

description: The attributes of the `category` object are used to define and customize individual x-axis labels for multi-series charts.

attrs.description: Opening price for the set.
attrs.name: open

attrs.description: Closing price for the set.
attrs.name: close

attrs.description: Highest price point reached for the set.
attrs.name: high

attrs.description: Lowest price point reached for the set.
attrs.name: low

attrs.description: Volume of transaction. If you do not specify volume for any of the sets, PowerCharts XT wouldn't plot the volume chart at the bottom.
attrs.name: volume
